content.label: I love the look and feel of this game. It was challenging and fun. I had no problems with the game on my iPad. Look forward to more from these guys!
Hermoso juego se merece mis 2$

By far the best game I have ever played on any of my apple devices. This game is so beautiful and the soundtrack its amazing! The puzzles are very challenging too. Great game make sure to buy it if you can.

I loved Samorost 3 and Chuchel, and while this one has the same amazing art and world building, the puzzles are rather tedious and unintuitive. I decided to quit at the minecart and claw puzzle where I have to keep redoing the same action sequence every time I try something that doesn’t work. Sometimes I don’t even know to click something because there are no hotspots. Sure there are hints, but that defeats the purpose. I think the designers learned from their mistakes and made their later games better...

I love this game - for its beautiful, steam punk/ dystopian picture-book aesthetic; for its quirky humor; and for the engaging adventure neatly interspersed with puzzles and challenges. My seven year old son and I have worked through the full game and we’re now on our second go, because it’s such a cool, imaginative world. On the strength of this, I’ve gotten hold of all the other Amanita games currently on the market, and they’re all awesome in different ways, but this is still my favorite.

This is a good puzzle solving game. A little hard to be honest , but they provide a hint page. However They literally show you how to solve all the puzzles step by step on the hint page, Kind of takes away from the game in my opinion. But on the flip side there are puzzles with zero hints what so ever,  so u have to access the walkthrough page if u really want to move solve them . Also to acces the walk through is annoying , i played that mini game like 3 dozens times. 

I doubt you can complete this game on the 1st go without using the walk through. Even tho  the hints are vague at times. I tried solving all the puzzles without the hints i got pretty far in each puzzle , but i got stuck at the end in a lot of them. And its always for the same reason,  i overlooked an item i missed (because items blend in to the surroundings way too good, need to give em a shine of sparkle) i cant recall how many times i walked passed something i needed because it was camoflaged into the background, lol. 

Good game.  Def recomend samorost 3 as well. Puzzles are a little easier to solve there.

I love the game, it's super cute, the puzzles can be really hard to figure out what you're supposed to do sometimes but the walkthrough is helpful. Only problem is I can't finish the game because the radio in the big tower won't play the song, I can't hear it even when I wear headphones, only the background music. I've watched walkthroughs so  I know I'm doing the right thing but the sound won't play and also when I go to use the little instrument with the keys outside they don't push down, and if they do I can only push them down once and then they get stuck there, stopping me from being able to play the notes. Gah! It's awesome in every other aspect. EDIT: I closed out of the app completely and reopened it, that seemed to fix it. Yay! Ending is kinda short tho I wish they went back and saved that little alien guy or whoever he was

I got this game back when Starbucks handed out cards where you could get games on Apple early. This game was challenging and super fun to play. The art in it was awesome and the game forces you to think outside the box to solve puzzles.
Frustrating and not in a good way. Waste of money.

title.label: fun but can’t get past a glitch

content.label: it’s a fun, interesting game but i’ve run into a glitch & cannot figure out how to get it fixed. even amongst forums & walkthroughs.

I have the bundle set for this game package and it’s one of the best games I’ve ever played. Visually beautiful, attention to detail is amazing, the characters are cute and the puzzles are nice and challenging- with help if you decide you need it. Things that I live for! I normally play on my iPad, but I downloaded Samorost to my iPhone for a change and machinarium to start all over again since I never finished. Botanicula was the cutest thing ever. Hope to see a game or two come out soon!

Machinarium is a mixed bag. On the plus side it’s a beautiful game with wonderfully drawn characters. The music is hit or miss; some of it is nicely done but some of it is just random noise. 

The problem is the plot, such as it is, is just a device to move you from logic puzzle to logic puzzle. And there were way too many logic puzzles for this game to be enjoyable. Most are too difficult and non-intuitive. I was constantly having to go online guides to figure out what I was supposed to do next.  Not an enjoyable experience.  

I thought I was purchasing an adventure game in the spirit of the Monkey Island series. Instead I got something that felt like math class.

This game is so much fun! Very challenging and unique in a lot of ways. Josef is a cute and determined robot who just wants to rescue his girl and escape Machinarium. You are given one free hint for each “area”, but this does not go a long way to helping solve the puzzle. I recommend playing the little spider shooter game within the guide book in your star menu for in depth assistance, when you’re stumped. The little additions of mini games just makes this game so much better! Hoping there is a second game soon!
This is game is on par with console and pc level games. Definitely worth the $5.00 price tag. BUY IMMEDIATELY.

title.label: BUY this game and don’t give up!

content.label: I believe this is the first review I’ve ever written. There as so many things I can say about this game. It’s difficult, stimulating, GORGEOUS, etc. The storyline is a ‘cutesie’ one, easy enough to follow along to, while the game proves to be complicated enough for any adult to find themselves head scratching here and there. The passion of the designers is evident in EVERY level/scene. The attention to detail, be it Tim flies or colors in the sky, is remarkable. If you enjoy a good puzzle and have the patience to wait for your robot to slowly stroll into the next room (I’ve contemplated hurling my phone at moments), do yourself a favor and buy. This. Game.
Interesting puzzles, great graphics and sound. Had lots of fun playing it. Wish it was longer!
Played with my daughter and we both loved it. It’s clearly made with a lot of love. Great story, art, humor and puzzles. The controls can be a bit clumsy at times.
Don’t change it it’s good and it’s a part of my childhood
This game is nothing like the Room....the puzzles are like big fish....the robots are like watching cartoons. There is no real control. Do not buy this game!!

I just finished the game. It’s like a great book in that it’s easy to find yourself unable to put it down. The story is sweet and the puzzles are just hard enough to get you slightly frustrated. The music is awesome and you will quickly like some of the characters. 

The main character has some sweet dance moves! I loved the artwork and wish they would come up with something to top this. But honestly that would be really hard to do.
I overall love the game but I absolutely HATE the Video Game level and the 5 in a row it’s was way too hard to beat, but in all like I said I loved the game.

title.label: Loved it but the controls were glitchy

content.label: I played this awhile back and I don’t remember having as hard of a time controlling the characters movement as much as I do now. Ended up stuck trying to get the bird by the arcade to break the wire but it wasn’t working and I feel like it’s because the controls aren’t responding the way they should. Would have loved to have played this through again but just can’t make it work.
Soo good game he loves to ecplore and he is so cute I love him :) and I’m playing CHUCHEL now :)))))))
I love this game it’s one of the best but it’s so short I need part two!
I’ve played Machinarium 3 time so far... fantastic game, have yet to find another one like it. How about developing Machinarium II ???

When I got to the third stage and moved some pieces one of them fell out and that was the piece you need. then owl comes and takes it you need to get it back. but once it is in your inventory you can’t put it back. I restarted the whole game 4 times. I like it until that part.

Beautiful concept, all 3 games are wonderful in their own way. I haven’t tried Chuchel yet but I’m betting it’ll be just as good. Machinarium is probably my favorite of the three, but only by a small margin. These guys are so talented, each game is completely unique in feel, sound and graphics. Never seen anything like it. Like a good film, they create a complete “feel” and immersive experience. Some puzzles are difficult, but it feels like you’re actually solving the puzzles (which are often a game within a game) with your mind and not just eyes like most “puzzle” games. “The Room” series are definitely worth a try but these Amanita games are a whole different territory. A joy for/in every sense. Thank you Amanita people!! :-)
Nice game but 5 in a row ruins it for me

I’ve played this game on the computer already and because of means of nostalgia I bought it in here, everything was fine until i bumped into the tic tac toe game, so far it’s nothing and nobody has show  any signs of being able to win it, and the difficulty level doesn't even meet with the old game!! It was so much easier then, I’ve been trying to solve this for more than two hours I just want to get on with the game!!!
This is still one of my favorite games, don’t screw that up with me
Third room in, crane picks you up but won't drop you.  Don't waste your money. Too buggy

I was really enjoying the game up until the prison safe puzzle with the green triangle. Unfortunately the “Cheat Book” is no help and basically tells you that to move on you need a to solve the puzzle. I wish there was a way to bypass the puzzle or rest it to something else like the wiki suggests but even when I step out of the room or reset the game the puzzle is the same.  If a developer is reading this please help me out! I really want to continue playing this visually beautiful and plot based game!

title.label: Fun, but too short and bad hint system

content.label: This game has great graphics and I love the tone.  The puzzles were interesting and generally well done.  There are two main drawbacks for me.  First, I think the game is too short given it’s price.  Second, I think the hint system, which is crucial for a game like this, has a terrible flaw.  Generally I don’t care that you have to play a mini game to access the walkthrough.  The problem is that it shows you the walkthrough for the area you’re in, regardless of where you might be in the chain of puzzles.  So you might have access to 6 or 7 areas and not be sure where to go next.  You’ll have to go to each area, play the mini game, and hope there’s something you can actually do there.  This also means that you will sometimes bypass the actual puzzle accidentally because the walkthrough for the area you’re in just has the final solution to another area’s puzzle.

It was so addicting and took a good amount of time to get through! My favorite app game EVER!! This company has such an amazing beautiful streak of awesome games,THANK YOU!!
PS: please tell me that new pc game ‘Creaks’ will be available on here??

It’s kind of difficult for me to pull the trigger on a game that costs money these days. There are so many free apps and games out there that I rarely see any value in it.

This game is different.

I was immediately drawn to this one by its beautiful artwork and animation. It’s like a steampunk-style creation with incredible graphics, a neat little story somehow told with no language, and scores of puzzles that you have to solve with virtually your own brains (though hints and blueprints can be acquired if you really get stuck). My six year-old daughter and I have a blast huddling together over my phone playing together and working out the puzzles with tiny clues often overlooked, and the story progresses at such a steady pace that you just can’t help but get absorbed by it. I would buy this game again and again without hesitation and I would recommend it to anyone.

I love everything about the game until I got the arcade. First, it’s way too difficult to powers up the machines on iPad. Next, the shooter game is difficult, and I wasn’t born in the 80’s so it’s hard for me.
It’s in a different language I understand English only

title.label: I wish I’d listened to the other reviewers...

content.label: ...who complained about the controls. I’m only on part 2 and can’t advance because I’m on an iPhone X and I can’t be precise enough to get a task done. What a waste of $5!
They made the stupid spider game way too long. I’m stuck on a simple task and it takes 10 minutes to get a clue (if you win). Wish I knew before I paid for it.

This is a fun game with very cute and clever animation. Some of it requires more poking around and less logic than I might like, but all in all it was really fun and entertaining. And lasts much longer than the $5 movie you could rent!

I’ve played this game over and over again. The art is beautiful. The story is interesting and funny. The puzzles are challenging and satisfying once complete. I’ve praised this game since it first released years ago, and I still keep coming back to do it all over again. 

My favorite memory is probably the first time I beat the old man at connect four. It took me so many tries! I did a celebration dance once I finally beat him. Haha!

Great story, great design, amazing creativity. 

You guys (Amanita Design) are amazingly creative!

I have finally found the perfect game. I love it because if you need something to do, you can spend hours on one level. It takes much longer the first time through. I would suggest that if you get this game, don’t look at tutorials online. The game is way more fun when you have to figure it out. And don’t worry, all the puzzles are possible. This game is beautiful, and the sound is crazy amazing for a mobile app. If I could rate more than five stars I would. Great job, devs.

It takes a while to get used to the mechanics of this game. One may be tempted to give up at the draw bridge (near the beginning) but persevere- you will get used to it! The puzzles were challenging but I didn’t need walk-throughs or clues. Sometimes the hints were helpful to point me in the right direction, but otherwise it just took a lot of thinking! Variety of puzzles and challenges. Some was logic, others made one think outside the box. Very well done!

I don’t know if you remember the game Cosmic Ozmo on the original Macintosh Plus computer from the 1980s, but this game is very much in the tradition of that game.  It’s very nicely designed and reminds me of a Jan Svankmajer film come to life!  Well done!
This game is the best!!! Although it is tricky, I love it!!
I really enjoyed playing this game and you will too!

The little robot is cute and his world is kind of interesting, but I didn't find the gameplay to be much fun at all. It's impossible to figure out what you need to do on some levels because some of the actions are just impossible to guess, so you have to go look at the clue book. At that point you're just following directions instead of solving puzzles on your own, and that just not much fun.
I loved Botanicula and was able to play the game on my iPhoneZ. But this game ... When I could see the details and items to collect, it was impossible to place them.  Very cute, but frustrating.

Es una lastima pero con el iphone x no funciona correctamente. Se congela la pantalla y cuando se va a usar una herramienta para resolver un problema no la acepta aunque esa sea la correcta. El juego sería estupendo si realmente funcionara con el iphone .

title.label: This is a hard game but it’s awesome

content.label: This game is the hardest game I have played on my iPad and its my 3rd favorite so it’s awesome
